snippet: Glaciers in the eastern and central Himalayas and the Tibetan Plateau are melting at a faster clip, a panel reports. But the melt is not likely to be the main factor influencing water availability at lower elevations, it says.
abstract: Glaciers in the eastern and central Himalayas and the Tibetan Plateau are melting at a faster clip, a panel reports. But the melt is not likely to be the main factor influencing water availability at lower elevations, it says.

headline.main: On the Fate of Asia's Great Rivers
